security deposit.definition: A lump sum the tenant pays in advance, usually refundable at the end of the lease minus damages.
security deposit.refund_conditions: Minus any damages beyond normal wear and tear

maintenance charges.definition: Monthly costs tenants may need to pay for upkeep of common areas or repairs.
maintenance charges.covers: Common area maintenance, security, water tank cleaning

termination clause.definition: Defines when and how either landlord or tenant can end the agreement early.
termination clause.penalties: May include forfeiture of security deposit

lock-in period.definition: The minimum time (e.g., 11 months) a tenant must stay before being allowed to leave without penalty.
lock-in period.penalty: Loss of security deposit if leaving early

subletting.definition: Renting the house/flat to another person without landlord permission. Often restricted.

late payment.definition: Extra charges or penalties if rent is not paid by the due date.
late payment.typical_penalty: Rs. 100-500 per day or 5-10% of rent

indemnity.definition: Means the tenant may have to compensate the landlord for losses caused by tenant's actions.
indemnity.scope: Covers damages, legal costs, and third-party claims
indemnity.limitations: Should not be unlimited or unreasonable

eviction.definition: Forcing the tenant to vacate the property due to non-payment, breach, or illegal activity.
eviction.grounds: Non-payment, breach of terms, illegal activities

rent escalation.definition: Yearly increase in rent, often by 5–10%.

notice period.definition: Time tenant or landlord must give before ending the lease (commonly 1–3 months).

utilities.definition: Tenant's responsibility to pay for electricity, water, gas, internet bills.
utilities.includes: Electricity, water, gas, internet, cable TV
utilities.exclusions: Property tax, maintenance charges (usually landlord's responsibility)

property damage.definition: Tenant is liable for damages beyond normal wear and tear.
property damage.exclusions: Normal wear and tear, structural issues
property damage.assessment: Usually assessed at time of vacating

furnishing.definition: Responsibility of maintaining provided furniture and appliances.
furnishing.tenant_duties: Keep clean, report damages, minor repairs

pets.definition: Rules regarding whether pets are allowed in the property.
pets.common_restrictions: No pets, small pets only, additional deposit

visitor restriction.definition: Limits on how long guests can stay without landlord approval.

registration.definition: Requirement to register the rental agreement at the local sub-registrar office.

stamp duty.definition: Government tax to make the agreement legally valid.
stamp duty.responsibility: Usually shared between landlord and tenant

rent due date.definition: The specific day of the month when rent must be paid.

advance rent.definition: Rent collected in advance for one or more months.
advance rent.refundable: Usually refundable at end of tenancy

property use.definition: Defines the purpose – usually residential only, not commercial.
property use.common_restrictions: Residential use only, no commercial activities

renewal clause.definition: Tenant's right to renew the agreement after expiry, often with revised rent.
renewal clause.rent_revision: Subject to market rates and mutual agreement

landlord access.definition: Conditions under which landlord can enter the property (e.g., repairs).

dispute resolution.definition: How legal disputes will be handled, usually via arbitration or local courts.
dispute resolution.jurisdiction: Usually local court where property is located

force majeure.definition: Events like natural disasters that excuse either party from fulfilling the contract.

habitable condition.definition: Landlord's responsibility to provide basic facilities like water, electricity, and safety.
habitable condition.includes: Water supply, electricity, basic safety measures

sample_rental_agreement: The tenant shall pay a security deposit of 2 months' rent. Rent is due on the 5th of every month. Late payment of rent shall attract a penalty of 5%. The agreement has a lock-in period of 11 months. Subletting is strictly prohibited without the landlord's written consent. Rent will escalate by 8% every year. The tenant must pay for utilities such as electricity, water, and internet. Pets are not allowed. The landlord may enter the premises with 24 hours notice for repairs. Either party may invoke the termination clause by giving 2 months' notice. The tenant shall be liable for property damage beyond normal wear and tear. Disputes shall be settled under the jurisdiction of Delhi courts. Stamp duty and registration charges shall be borne equally by both parties.
